name: They Overcame Hardship Online Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: F.D.R. suffered from polio, but still led the U.S. When did he contract the disease?
questions.explanation:
Before becoming president.

	He contracted the disease well before he became president.

questions.text: Cervantes was injured in combat at the battle of Lepanto. What was his injury?
questions.explanation:
One of his limbs.

	The author of 'Don Quixote' received a severe injury in one of his arms and was known thereafter as 'El Manco (Cripple) of Lepanto'.

questions.text: Abraham Lincoln may have suffered from this disease.
questions.explanation:
Marfan's disease.

	As I understand it, this is a disorder of the connective tissue which causes skeletal problems (and may affect the aorta) and causes the victim to have a 'gangly' appearance.

questions.text: Virginia Woolf apparently suffered from this illness.
questions.explanation:
Manic-Depressive Disorder.

	She had a tough life, marked by many breakdowns, but still established herself as a major writer. This is the probable diagnosis. Unfortunately, the end result was suicide.

questions.text: The prominent physicist and author, Stephen Hawking, suffered from which illness?
questions.explanation:
A.L.S.

	Hawking suffered from 'Lou Gehrig's Disease'.

Stammering.

	As a child, he stammered - but went on to become a great orator.

questions.text: John Kennedy suffered from Addison's Disease. This condition involves what part of the body?
questions.explanation:
Adrenal Glands.

	Earlier in the century it might have been a fatal illness.

questions.text: Helen Keller lost her sight and her hearing. At approximately what age did this happen?
questions.explanation:
Two years old.

	She was about nineteen months old.

questions.text: Beethoven suffered from which of these maladies?
questions.explanation:
Deafness.

	A deaf composer? Only Beethoven could pull it off.

questions.text: John Milton suffered from what condition?
questions.explanation:
Blindness.

	The author of 'Paradise Lost' went blind.
